item.title: Next Steps in Desiging our Proof of Concept
Presenting our PDP and Gauging Peer Feedback
Evaluating Expert Feedback and Market Solutions
item.description: Understanding the core issue with bad posture… Posted 2023-09-19 | Previous Post: Searching for Problems… | Next Post: Presenting our PDP and Gauging Peer Feedback With a team member personally affected by back pain, we had the opportunity to speak and discuss openly with a professional, it truly changed the direction of our project, and solidified our focus. â€œSedentary behaviour is a precursor to lower back pain, which has unfortunately become a silent epidemic in our society.

item.title: Searching for Problems...
item.description: How to find problems? It’s not easy! Posted 2023-09-19 | Previous Post: Forming the team! | Next Post: Evaluating Expert Feedback and Market Solutions Every project starts with a planning phase, and engineering design is no different. Often the way we structure brainstorming sessions has a large influence in the ideas that we generate, therefore keeping true to form was key in making sure we found success. Everyone, in one way or another, is a consumer.

item.title: Forming the team!
item.description: Forming the team, and thinking about the big picture Posted 2023-09-12 | Next Post: Searching for Problems… Without a concrete idea in mind for our capstone project, it was important to build a team that could tackle any challenge! Having a mix of software, electrical and mechanical experience would set the team up for success, but more importantly, each member would have to get along with one another, trust in each other, and share a common vision for the direction of the project.
